active_learning.discussion_prompt: Using the NID Model, debate whether a viral Twitter thread from an anonymous researcher (with past mixed accuracy) reporting a zero-day exploit deserves a B3 or C4 rating. Justify your position with real-world implications for threat hunting, such as resource allocation and false positive risks. Address common misconceptions like over-relying on source popularity.
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains Source Reliability ratings (A-F) using examples/non-examples (e.g., MITRE ATT&CK = A, rumor forum = D), while the partner explains Information Reliability (1-6) (e.g., confirmed by multiple vendors = 1, contradicts known facts = 5). Switch roles and provide teach-back feedback.
active_learning.problem_solving: Present students with 4 real-world/mock sources on a phishing campaign (e.g., vendor blog, dark web leak, news article, social media post). In small groups, rate each using the NID Model, prioritize for threat hunting action, and present findings with rationale. Reflect on how this mirrors daily intel analyst tasks.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Threat Intelligence. Topic: Source Quality Evaluation (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Threat Intelligence And Hunting > Threat Intelligence Platforms > 003_Threat Intelligence Lifecycle > Feedback > Source Quality Evaluation). Use the NID Model fully: Source Reliability A-F, Information Reliability 1-6 (as detailed below), handling instructions. Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [paste full list above]. - Active Learning: [reference activities for hooks/explanations]. - Scaffolding: Generate cards progressively across 4 layers [paste scaffolding]. - Bloom's: Distribute evenly (4-6 per level), tag each card. - Generate 25-30 high-quality flashcards: 40% basic/cloze, 60% MCQ. Follow exact schema [paste schema]. NID Details: [paste full Layer 2 Components]. Ensure completeness (levels 5-6 included). Distractors per protocol. Explanations pedagogical, with formative assessments (2-3 MCQs, 1 scenario, reflection). Output ONLY valid JSON array of cards.
